unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Chi-Squared GOF Test
question_text: The vegetable sales at a local convenience store last year broke down as follows: $34\%$ broccoli, $21\%$ peas, $18\%$ carrots, $17\%$ cabbage, and $10\%$ beans. Recently a random sample of $123$ vegetable-buying customers found that $39$ bought broccoli, $23$ bought peas, $20$ bought carrots, $17$ bought cabbage, and $24$ bought beans. A chi-squared goodness of fit test was performed. Determine the test statistic, $p$ -value, and degrees of freedom.

choices.text: Test statistic: 23.42 23.42 P P -value: 0.01 0.01 Degrees of freedom: 122 122
Test statistic: 12.57 12.57 P P -value: 0.01 0.01 Degrees of freedom: 122 122
Test statistic: 12.57 12.57 P P -value: 0.01 0.01 Degrees of freedom: 4 4
Test statistic: 23.42 23.42 P P -value: 0.025 0.025 Degrees of freedom: 122 122
Test statistic: 12.57 12.57 P P -value: p < 0.0005 p < 0.0005 Degrees of freedom: 4 4
